meanings.definition: Given as an honor or in recognition of achievement without the usual requirements or privileges.
meanings.sent1: The club awarded him an honorary membership for his dedication.
meanings.sent2: She received an honorary degree for her outstanding contributions to the field.
meanings.sent3: Being named an honorary citizen of the town made him feel proud.
meanings.sent4: Her honorary title of 'Queen of Kindness' was well-deserved.
meanings.sent5: The honorary medal shone brightly on his chest, symbolizing his hard work.

meanings.definition: Holding a position or title without the usual responsibilities or duties.
meanings.sent1: As an honorary chairman, he attended meetings but had no voting power.
meanings.sent2: The honorary president of the organization was mainly a figurehead.
meanings.sent3: The honorary librarian had the key to the library but rarely used it.
meanings.sent4: Her honorary role as team captain brought her recognition but no extra work.
meanings.sent5: The honorary ambassador traveled the world representing the country with pride.
